'''FireDrums''' is an annual fire arts gathering held in Northern California. It is one of the longest-running dedicated fire performance events in the United States.<ref name="firedrums">{{cite web |url=https://firedrums.org/ |title=FireDrums |publisher=FireDrums |access-date=2026-02-11}}</ref>

== History ==

FireDrums was first organized by Sky Rockit in 2004 on a San Francisco beach.<ref name="firedrums" /> The event grew into a multi-day gathering and has been held annually since. In recent years, the event has taken place in Wilseyville, California. [[Noel Yee]] has been involved with the organization, though the specific nature and timeline of his role is not fully documented.

== Format ==

FireDrums typically features approximately 100 workshops over a weekend, covering a range of fire and flow arts disciplines.<ref name="firedrums" /> The event includes:

* '''Workshops''': Instruction in fire [[poi]], [[Staff (flow arts)|staff]], [[Fire fans|fans]], [[Rope dart|rope dart]], and other fire props
* '''Fire circle''': An open spinning area with live music at night, where performers share the space
* '''Performances''': Scheduled shows and showcases
* '''Community discussions''': Panels on safety, teaching, and the future of fire arts

== Significance ==

FireDrums has served as an important gathering point for the [[flow arts]] community, particularly for sharing technical knowledge and safety practices related to [[fire spinning]].
